channel.title: Group Theory on ButterCat
channel.description: Recent content in Group Theory on ButterCat

item.title: Study Notes on Group Theory
item.description: From permutation to group theory Everyone knows permutation. Permutation counts the number of ways that we can exchange a set of element. Take a simple example of permutation of three objects naming it with integer (123). There are \( 3!=6 \) ways of rearranging these three elements into different orders. Let’s list out all the six orders: $$ (123), (132), (231), (213), (312), (321)$$ Looking at a different perspective, we can also treat each permutation of the element \( (123) \) as a transformation to \( (123) \).
